ab.title: Genesis 19
ab.l: And the two envoys cameto Sodom in the evening, and Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom,and Lot saw and rose up to meet them and he bowedwith his face toward the ground.

And he said, ‘Lo, I pray you,my lords, turn in now, into your servant’s house, and spend the night and washyour feet, and you shall rise up early and go on your way.’ Andthey said, ‘No, for we will spend the night in the street.’
And he pressedthem greatly, and they turned in to him, and entered his house,and he made for them drink and baked cake, and they ate.
But before they lay down, the men of the city, the menof Sodom, surrounded the house, both youth and old,all the people to the last |man|.
And they calledLot, and said to him, ‘Where are the men who cameto you this night? Bring them out to us, and let us harass them.’
And Lot went out to them at the door, andshut the covering |of the door| behind him.
And he said, ‘I prayyou, brothers, do not do bad.

Lo, now,I have two daughters who have not known a man. Let me bring them outto you, and do you to them as it seems good in your eyes. Onlyto these men do nothing, because they have cometo have shelter in the shadow of my ceiling.’

And they said,‘Move away!’ And they said, ‘This one came to live, and thenhe surely judged! Now we will do worse |things|to you than to them!’ And they harassed Lot, the man, greatly and came near to breakthe door.
But the men reachedtheir hand out and brought Lot into the houseand shut the covering of the door.
And they smote the men that were at the door of the housewith blindness, both small and great, and they wearied |themselves|with finding the door.
And the mensaid to Lot, ‘Whom do you have here besides? Son-in-law, andyour sons, and your daughters, and anyone you havein the city, bring them out of the place.
Because we are destroyingthis place, because their cry has become bigbefore the Lord, and the Lord has sent us to destroyit.’

And Lot went out, and spoke to his sons-in-law,who married his daughters, and said, ‘Arise, get out of this place,because the Lord will destroy the city.’ But he seemedas one who mocks in the eyes of his sons-in-law.
Andwhen the morning arose, then the envoys urgedLot, saying, ‘Arise, take your wife, andyour two daughters who are here, lest you be perished because of the iniquityof the city.’
But he lingered, sothe men seized his hand, and his wife’s hand, and the handsof his two daughters, with the Lord’s mercy on him,and they brought him out and set him outside the city.
And it was when they were bringing them out,|and| he said, ‘Escape for your life. Do not look behind you,neither stay in all the valley, escape to the mountain, lestyou be perished.’
And Lot said to them, ‘I pray you,my lords.

Lo, now, your servant has found favour in your eyes,and you have magnified your kindness, which you have done to me inkeeping my soul alive. But I cannot escape to themountain, lest some evil reach me, and I die.
Lo, now, this city is near to flee there, and it is small. Let me escapenow there — lo, it is small — and my soul shall stay alive.’
And the envoy said to him, ‘Lo, I granted you a favourin this matter as well, not to ruin the city of which you have spoken.
Hurry, escape there, because I cannot doanything until you get there.’ Therefore the name of it the city was called Zoar.
The sun was shining upon the earth when Lotcame to Zoar.
Then the Lord rainedsulphur and fire on Sodom and on Gomorrah, fromthe Lord out of the skies.
And he ruined thosecities, and all the valley, andall the inhabitants of the cities, and what grew on the ground.
But his wife looked behind him, and she becamea pillar of salt.
And Abraham rose up early at dawnto the place where he stood before the Lord.
And he looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah and toward allthe land of the valley, and he looked, and, lo, thick smoke of the land was risinglike the smoke of a lime kiln.
And it was,when God destroyed the cities of the valley, that God rememberedAbraham, and sent Lot out of the midstof the ruining, when he ruined the citiesin one of which Lot dwelt.
And Lot went up from Zoar,and dwelt in the mountain, and his two daughters with him,because he feared to dwell in Zoar, and he dwelt in a cave,he and his two daughters.
And the older saidto the younger, ‘Our father is old, and there is not a man on the earthto come to us after the way of all the earth.
Come,let us make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, thatwe may revive offspring from our father.’
And they made their own father drinkwine that night. And the older came and laywith her father. And he did not know when she lay down, or when she arose.

And it was after dawn that the older said to the younger, ‘Lo,I lay last night with my father. Let us make him drink wine this night as well,and you come and lie with him, that we may revive offspring from our father.’
And they made their own father drink wine that night as well,and the younger arose and lay with him,and he did not know when she lay down, or when she arose.
And both the daughters of Lot became pregnant by their father.
The older bore a son and called his nameMoab. He was the father of the Moabites to this day.
The younger also bore a sonand called his name Ben-Ammi. He was the father of Ammonto this day.
